info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 2:56PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Reduced Visibility over Mountain Passes... Patchy dense fog has developed over the mountains of Central Montana this afternoon, with visibilities as low as one quarter of a mile, especially over mountain passes. Some areas that were observing these reduced visibilities included but are not limited to the US Hwy 89 corridor through the Little Belt Mountains, Montana Hwy 200 corridor over Rogers Pass, US Hwy 12 corridor over MacDonald Pass, and the I-15 corridor between Helena and Butte. Be prepared for changing condtions over short distances and use low beam headlights when driving through fog. Additionally, with air temperatures below freezing the fog may begin to freeze on surfaces leading to slippery conditions. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.
